column4: now where is that shiny new X config window that is prised in the news? i still get the old one in system->prefs and the news don't mention hot to start the new one

ok, i have german menus. the closest thing translates into "screen resolution" and thats the old one. do i need to install something? i was using gutsy for months. but the system is up to date as of today
i'm on AMD64 is the new one maybe not compatible?

hm, im not sure what it would translate into in german.  but it sounds to me like you're looking in system>preferences.  that's where my "screen resolution" menu item is.  my "screens and graphics" window is in system>administration, make sure you look there rather than system>preferences.
then something seems to be missing here. all i find there that is GUI related is the gdm config.
hm, thats interesting.  what is right after the restricted manager menu item?
that starts with a "v" in the translation and is the very last line
bah, darn translations :-P  i'm not sure what to tell you then unfortunately :-(
do you know the package name? i just browsed the not installed packages in base, gnome and system section but i did not find an uninstalled package that could be it
let me see if i can find it
looks like the package is called "displayconfig-gtk"
yep that exists and is not (yet) installed
install away and see if that's what you're looking for, and let me know if i was correct :-)
installed "bildschirme und grafik" which translates fine into english, and it looks fine. is that accidently not a dependency of the gnome-desktop package? (bug)
im not sure how it wasn't installed for you, i installed gutsy from scratch and it was installed by default, definitely strange
anyway, thanks. i made some changes and will see if they actually work on next login :-)
